comment.narrative: Bamboo carbon credit site finalised at Agoga district of Uganda, local partner Eco-Ways identified, mobilising investor in place with Face the Future. A training programme on bamboo allometric and hydrology for 27(19M/8F) researchers of KEFRI completed in collaboration with IISWC India(https://www.inbar.int/training-bamboo-allometric-soils-kenya/). Research site established with gauging facility with multi-slot deviser for monitoring the run-off and soil loss data at Gede, Malindi Sub-county (Geo-Coordinates of the research plot: -3.2997970(Latitude) and 39.99679270(Longitude). The research team finalised the ecologically important species: Dendrocalamus asper, Bambusa vulgaris, and Oxytenanthera abyssinica were planted at spacing of 5meterX5meter in completely randomised block design using three replications at the research site.
Due to COVID19 pandemic and travel restrictions , the activities did not initiate and shifted to year 2.

The pre-feasibility study completed in Kalalongo, Agoga district of Uganda for setting-up bamboo carbon project in partnership with Face the Future, The Netherlands. Based on the feasibility study, a bamboo carbon project design has been initiated in partnership with the Face the Future. Research on bamboo development plot for growth, soil and hydrology studies of Kenya in progress.
Bamboo carbon credit project established; one environmental research plot; one report and journal paper; 2 capacity building training (50 researchers).
